snippet: The Federal Communications Commission has asked Congress if it has the authority to repeal a 1975 rule that required sports stadiums to be sold out before broadcasting a game.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission proposes repealing its 1975 blackout rule that requires sports stadiums to be sold out before broadcasting a game.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Communications Commission has asked Congress if it has the authority to repeal a 1975 rule that required sports stadiums to be sold out before broadcasting a game.

headline.main: F.C.C. Seeks to Do Away With Sports Blackout Rule
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Seeks to Do Away With Sports Blackout Rule
